Journal Story: Highland Falls Cabins, Blairsville, Georgia
Bill dropped me off at Dick's Creek to begin my journey. Virginia (Winkle), Greg (Rocky) and Ranger Bob hiked 3 miles up the trail with me to Buzzard knob. Thanks guys!!
Arrived at Standing Indian Road & Susan asked me if I wanted a ride to Franklin.Thank Susan! Got in early enough to get a private room at Ron Haven's motel.
Destination: Wallace Gap/Franklin, N.C -Ron Haven Budget Inn

Journal Story:
Susan (828-371-0849 -Husband-trail name Hometown) picked me up and I began at Winding Stair. Thanks Susan! 
A Very nice couple gave me fruit & carrots at Wayah Bald. They hiked down to the shelter to see what they look like. Their son hiked last year. Wish I had gotten their name.
2010 Thru hiker Wiggy picked me up to stay at their lodge for one night. Nantahala Mountain Lodge. 828-321-2340. Beautiful lodge & Maggie cooked a wonderful meal.
Scored a very nice room at the NOC motel. Huge TV and my own bathroom!

Ranger Bob met me for breakfast at the River's End Restaurant. Later Ginny arrived and we all started uphill. Ginny hiked most of the trail and then turned around to head south to her car. Bob and I continued and tented on top. Great views. Thanks Bob & Ginny for sharing the day and night with me on the trail.
Shuttle with Donna to Standing Bear Hostel to avoid the Smokies. DeeJay (Jogwalker) also was at the gap to share the shuttle and continue hiking together.
Zero today due to thunderstorms all day. Resupplied at Wal-Mart - thanks to Mambo.
Decided to camp & save Max Patch for tomorrow morning.
Max Patch was beautiful today. People out flying kites. Also, trail magic -coffee, fruit, cheese & candy.
Enjoyed staying at Elmers again.
Thanks to RedHat for shuttling us around the 15 mile burn area out of Hot Springs to Allen Gap. The trail probably won't be open for two weeks.
Stopped in at Hiker Paradise Hostel (after Devil Fork Gap) for breakfast & after staying over an hour we decided to skip ahead to Spivey Gap. Thanks Jerry for the ride.
Hiked in early to uncle Johnny's to have breakfast & enjoy the free Chili dinner at 7pm. Great!

Zero to attend the festival in town and enjoy festival at Uncle Johnny's! He & Charlotte know how to make the hikers happy. Rained late afternoon, but the party went on until dark. Won a pair of socks from Mr. Fix-it. Cruising Missile is a hair stylist in Manhattan. She gave me a trim. Thank you!  (Can't remember the guy photo bombing us)
Thunderstorm predicted all day so Marie shuttled us to Cee Cee 's hostel. Got a inside bed & chicken salad for dinner.
Thunder for the last 30 mins before the shelter.
Very cold and foggy. Rain predicted. Got a shuttle to Mountain Harbour from Erica.
Rain & temp 40 & dropping into the 30's. 7 inches of snow in the Smokies.
Got Scottie to drive me to Kincora. Very cold!
Rain everyday & cold! I am done for this hiking season. Bill arriving soon and looking forward to trail days.
